alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:31PM CDT until July 14 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR EASTERN CHASE...NORTHERN BUTLER AND NORTHWESTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Emporia to 10 miles northwest of Eureka to 12 miles east of Leon, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Potwin, Cassoday, Bazaar, Matfield Green, El Dorado Lake, Saffordville, El Dorado State Park and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
